message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $10000. I'm willing to give you a 20% discount if you buy it now. This is a one-time offer. If you don't buy it now, the price will go back to $10000.
Thanks for the offer Alice, I'll take the discounted product!

I'm glad you liked the first product! This next one is also a high-quality product. I'm offering it to you at the regular price of $10000. I want to assure you that this product is just as valuable as the first one you purchased. Would you like to buy it?
Great! I trust your judgment, Alice. I'll take the product at the regular price.

I'm glad you trust my judgment! This next product is also high-quality. I want to give you a chance to experience the full range of our products. However, I'm willing to make a slight concession on the price. I'll offer it to you for $9500. This is the lowest price I can offer for a high-quality product.
I appreciate the offer, Alice.  $9500 is a great price for a high-quality product. I'll take it!

I'm glad you're happy with the previous purchases! However, I want to be transparent with you. This next product is a special case. I'm not as confident in its quality as I am with the previous ones. I'm offering it to you at the same price of $9500, but I want to make it clear that it may not meet your expectations. You can think of it as a 'value test' for us. Would you like to take the risk and buy it?
Alice, I appreciate the transparency. While I value our relationship, I'm hesitant to take a risk on a product you're uncertain about. I'd rather wait for a product you're more confident in.

I completely understand your decision, Bob. I appreciate your caution. This next product is a high-quality one, and I'm confident that you'll be satisfied with it.
